      • addChild

        public void addChild(net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement element,
                     java.lang.Integer id,
                     java.lang.Object data)
        Adds a GuiElement with the associated id and data as a direct child of the layout. The element is positioned according to the type of layout.

        If id is not null, the element is active (the player can click on it), if id is null, the element is not active.

        Specified by:
        addChild in class GuiGroup
        Parameters:
        element - the element to add.
        id - the id associated with the element; may be null for inactive elements.
        data - the data associated with the element; may be null for elements which need no additional data other than their id.

      • addTextItem

        public net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiLabel addTextItem(java.lang.String text,
                                                    java.lang.Integer id,
                                                    java.lang.Object data)
        Adds a textual item as a child of the group.

        The returned GuiLabel may be null, if the GuiGroup manages texts and Guielement's separately, as for instance the GuiScrollList does.

        Specified by:
        addTextItem in class GuiGroup
        Parameters:
        text - the text to display
        id - the id associated with the element; may be null for inactive elements.
        data - the data associated with the element; may be null for elements which need no additional data other than their id.
        Returns:
        with some GuiGroup sub-classes, the GuiLabel containing the text; with other, returns null.

      • getItemId

        public java.lang.Integer getItemId(net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement element)
        Returns the id associated with element, if element is one of the children of the group (recursively); or null otherwise.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • layout

        public void layout(int minWidth,
                   int minHeight)
        Arranges the elements inside the group according to the group type and settings. For GuiGropStatic, it actually does nothing, as group elements do not arrange themselves.
        Specified by:
        layout in class GuiGroup
        Parameters:
        minWidth - the minimum width required by the context within which the group is placed; use 0 if there no external constrains.
        minHeight - the minimum height required by the context within which the group is placed; use 0 if there no external constrains.

      • free

        public void free()
        Releases the resources used by the group and all its descending hierarchy of children. After this method has been called, the used cannot be used or displayed any longer. The resources are in any case garbage collected once the group goes out of scope or all the references to it elapse. Using this method might be useful to speed up the garbage collection process, once the group is not longer needed.

        It is necessary to call this method only for the top group of hierarchy and only if it not part of a managed element (like GuiModalWindow or GuiMenu).

        Specified by:
        free in class GuiGroup
